snippet: Kenya’s decision to elect a president charged with crimes against humanity poses a challenge for the West.
abstract: Editorial expresses unease about election of Uhuru Kenyatta as president of Kenya, in light of fact that he has been charged with crimes against humanity; contends United States and Europe are going to have to find way to work with new government if Kenyatta withstands expected legal challenge by his opponent Raila Odinga.
lead_paragraph: Kenya’s decision to elect a president charged with crimes against humanity poses a challenge for the West.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
